# present(_:atTime:)

**Instance Method**

Presents a drawable at a specific time.

## Declaration

```swift
func present(_ drawable: any MTLDrawable, atTime presentationTime: CFTimeInterval)
```

## Parameters

- **drawable**: An [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable] instance that contains a texture the system can show on a display.
- **presentationTime**: The Mach absolute time, in seconds, that you want to present the drawable.

## Discussion

This convenience method calls the drawable’s [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present(at:)] method after the command queue schedules the command buffer for execution. The command buffer does this by adding a completion handler by calling its own [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/addScheduledHandler(_:)] method for you.



## Presenting a drawable

- **present(_:)**: Presents a drawable as early as possible.
- **present(_:afterMinimumDuration:)**: Presents a drawable after the system presents the previous drawable for an amount of time.
